intro: Teucrium kotschyanum, commonly known as the Persian germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually blue to purple in color, blooming in summer. Teucrium kotschyanum is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
